channel.title: Lawnmower Trouble
channel.description:
Correct section?
I am having trouble "starting" my lawnmower. The motor will run but the filter or whatever it's called will spit out white smoke and the sound of the mower sounds very unusual. I did some Google searches and it said I might be low on oil, I filled it with gas too much and it's burning it up, or I need to clean something.
I am a retard with small engines and such, so bare with me.

item.title: Lawnmower Trouble
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:19, topic:290509”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=384069.msg2884104#msg2884104 date=1248491260]
All of the lawnmowers we have here are 4 stroke, usually either made by Briggs and Stratton or Tecumseh (or lately by honda).
[/quote]

Why do you know so much about lawnmowers?[/quote]

Before I was old enough to work on cars I worked on lawnmowers

[quote=“maniown, post:18, topic:290509”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=384069.msg2884104#msg2884104 date=1248491260]
All of the lawnmowers we have here are 4 stroke, usually either made by Briggs and Stratton or Tecumseh (or lately by honda).
[/quote]

john deere also.[/quote]

No, john deere doesn’t make their own engines, they usually use briggs and stratton or kohler.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawnmower Trouble
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

His truck has 4 lawnmower engines instead of a real one.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawnmower Trouble
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Moparisthebest:

All of the lawnmowers we have here are 4 stroke, usually either made by Briggs and Stratton or Tecumseh (or lately by honda).

Why do you know so much about lawnmowers?

Read full topic

item.title: Lawnmower Trouble
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:17, topic:290509”][quote author=Chassy13 link=topic=384069.msg2882617#msg2882617 date=1248416271]

Yeah, I mixed it. I just started mowing anyway and eventually the white smoke quit and it ran fine. Thanks for the help.

Why did you mix gas with the oil? You only have to do that on 2 cycle engines (some boat motors, a few dirtbikes and ATVs) and I’ve never seen a lawnmower that wasn’t 4 cycle. If it is a 4 cycle motor and you mixed oil in with the gas, that is the cause of the white smoke, and there is a separate place to put in oil and check the oil level, which you should probably do.

I have to tip the lawnmower over and clean off the grass from the blades after I am done cutting the grass. I must have tipped it the wrong way and it mixed. That or it was when I spilled some gas and it probably leaked inside. I didn’t purposely mix it. I ran it for about 10 minutes and the smoke disappeared and never came back for the rest of the lawn. I’m pretty sure it’s good on oil but I will check it the next time to be sure.
[/quote]

Yes, if you tip it too much oil will get into the cylinder, causing smoke.

Don’t forget 2 stroke chainsaws mopar

Yep, chainsaws and weed eaters too. Good call.

I’ve never seen a lawnmower that wasn’t 4 cycle.

That’s weird, I don’t think I’ve ever seen a lawnmower that isnt 2-stroke o_O

Little 2-stroke moped engines are even colloquially called lawnmower engines here

Weird, must be a country thing, like you guys have lots of diesel cars and the only diesels we have are trucks. All of the lawnmowers we have here are 4 stroke, usually either made by Briggs and Stratton or Tecumseh (or lately by honda).[/quote]

john deere also.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawnmower Trouble
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:11, topic:290509”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=384069.msg2882413#msg2882413 date=1248410904]

Yeah, I mixed it. I just started mowing anyway and eventually the white smoke quit and it ran fine. Thanks for the help.

Why did you mix gas with the oil? You only have to do that on 2 cycle engines (some boat motors, a few dirtbikes and ATVs) and I’ve never seen a lawnmower that wasn’t 4 cycle. If it is a 4 cycle motor and you mixed oil in with the gas, that is the cause of the white smoke, and there is a separate place to put in oil and check the oil level, which you should probably do.
[/quote]

I have to tip the lawnmower over and clean off the grass from the blades after I am done cutting the grass. I must have tipped it the wrong way and it mixed. That or it was when I spilled some gas and it probably leaked inside. I didn’t purposely mix it. I ran it for about 10 minutes and the smoke disappeared and never came back for the rest of the lawn. I’m pretty sure it’s good on oil but I will check it the next time to be sure. :P[/quote]

Yes, if you tip it too much oil will get into the cylinder, causing smoke.

RXVL:

Don’t forget 2 stroke chainsaws mopar

Yep, chainsaws and weed eaters too. Good call.

[quote=“Mopman, post:16, topic:290509”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=384069.msg2882413#msg2882413 date=1248410904]
I’ve never seen a lawnmower that wasn’t 4 cycle.
[/quote]

That’s weird, I don’t think I’ve ever seen a lawnmower that isnt 2-stroke o_O

Little 2-stroke moped engines are even colloquially called lawnmower engines here[/quote]

Weird, must be a country thing, like you guys have lots of diesel cars and the only diesels we have are trucks. All of the lawnmowers we have here are 4 stroke, usually either made by Briggs and Stratton or Tecumseh (or lately by honda).

Read full topic

I have to tip the lawnmower over and clean off the grass from the blades after I am done cutting the grass. I must have tipped it the wrong way and it mixed. item.title: Lawnmower Trouble
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Chassy13:

Yeah, I mixed it. I just started mowing anyway and eventually the white smoke quit and it ran fine. Thanks for the help.

Why did you mix gas with the oil? You only have to do that on 2 cycle engines (some boat motors, a few dirtbikes and ATVs) and I’ve never seen a lawnmower that wasn’t 4 cycle. If it is a 4 cycle motor and you mixed oil in with the gas, that is the cause of the white smoke, and there is a separate place to put in oil and check the oil level, which you should probably do.

Read full topic

item.title: Lawnmower Trouble
item.dc:creator: @maniown maniown
item.description:
@maniown wrote:

Chassy13:

Not worth spending 200$ when the problem can most likely be fixed. I started it again, and the white smoke wasn’t as bad. I started mowing, and then it went back to thick white smoke. Most people have said it isn’t anything to worry about, and it’s probably just gas mixed with oil.

Sounds like you put some diesel or gas/oil mix in. Just run it out, our clean your gas lines and empty the tank.

Read full topic
